lines.text: But, Boss, I tink...
With what?
Die the way you lived, all of a sudden, that's the way to go. Don't drag it out.
I was born at home, because I wanted to be near Mother at the time.
And I'm not sure, maybe ideals have ceased to exist. Maybe they're outmoded like um
[pauses]
oil lamps and horse cars. But they're mine, and I'm stuck with them.
Don't commute me - I don't want it. Hey, look, Jim, if I can't live the way I want, then at least let me die the way I want.
I'm going to clean out every rotten spot I can find in this city, and, Blackie, I don't want to find you in any of them!
Well I'm not dressed for company!
You better cross yourself, Manny, and make it double, because this is once you doubled-crossed yourself.
Have you left anything at your table, I mean, anything that you have to go back for?
I'm fully equipped.
You know, I think those yes-men would go to bed with me if they had a chance.
Don't worry, Darling, they won't have a chance.
Now, now Blackie, Blackie don't do anything foolish!... Blackie?

[Chuckles]
Did I ever do anything foolish?
Nothing like a district attorney to keep a girl in shape. You and I must have a good wrestle someday.

[to the priest]
It must be nice in jail, with you there.
Entertaining your gunslinger pals is bad enough, but politicians? Oh, no, that's out!
